topic.title: Introduction

body.p: This document defines the design parameters of the device. It provides essential reading for system designers requiring a detailed understanding of this device's functions, physical characteristics, and interfaces. This document also provides a description of the software APIs in the context of the hardware, to assist the user with configuring the device from a system level perspective.
This document is one of a family of documents about this device and should be read in conjunction with the following documents:

li.p: The Product Overview. This document provides a high level overview of the device and provides system application examples.
The Hardware Design Guide. This document provides information relevant for the design of a printed circuit board that uses the device.

The Software Integration Guide. This document describes the porting layer of the device software in sufficient detail to allow integration into a host operating system. The intended audience is software developers who are considering software integration issues such as PCIe enumeration, transfer of PMON into shared memory, interrupt processing, support big or little endian host processors, building the software, multithreading support, and supporting multiple device support.
